Add.Title: Form Builder
Add.TeaserDescription: Build well-designed, mobile-friendly and accessible web forms in no time.
Add.Content:
Build well-designed web forms in no time

The Form Builder allows you to quickly build well-designed, mobile-friendly and accessible web forms with validation and semantics like e-mail fields in place by simply using "drag-and-drop" and add them to a page.

You can get the form's input by e-mail, export it to XML or Excel or view it in the C1 CMS Console. Besides, you can integrate it with a custom back-end system, for example, a CRM.

You can also extend the Form Builder with new field types such as "get Google Map coordinates" or submit actions such as "Save to CRM".

You can easily customize its "look and feel" by editing HTML and CSS behind it, based on Bootstrap 3 out of the box.

Add.Title: Social Links
Add.TeaserDescription: Displays social media links on your website as well-designed icon buttons.
Add.Content:
Display links to your social media as branded icons.

Nowadays, both people and organizations have accounts in various social media services such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn.

This package allows you to add a few branded buttons that, when clicked, will redirect visitors to your profiles with these social media services.

The following social media services are supported: Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Flickr, YouTube and many more.

There are also buttons for email addresses and Skype URI links, too.

You can control the way the buttons look: their size, their color theme and their form. You can also choose how the buttons will look on small screens.

Add.Title: Package Creator
Add.TeaserDescription: Allows you to add an item in one of the perspectives in the C1 CMS Console to a CMS package.
Add.Content:
Create your own packages and reuse them on other CMS sites

Composite.Tools.PackageCreator allows you to right-click an item in one of the perspectives in the C1 CMS Console  and add it to a package, then create and download the package as a ZIP file when done. You can add the following items to the package:

  • Flat files (like CSS, JS, CS, ASPX, PNG, etc)
  • Whole directory structures
  • Layout templates
  • The entire media archive or individual media folders with files
  • Global data types, page data folders and Page meta types
  • All or individual data items from data types
  • Razor, XSLT, User Control and C# functions
  • Pages as page trees
  • Configuration settings from ~\Web.config and ~\App_Data\Composite\Composite.config
  • CMS Console GUI localizations

You can also exclude individual data items of various types from packages.

Note: If you have created a package which you would like to share with other CMS developers, you can submit it at our Add-On Market.

Add.Title: Link Checker
Add.TeaserDescription: Ensure there are no broken links to published CMS pages on your website.
Add.Content:
Check your web pages for broken links

Link Checker allows you to check your website for broken links.

Once checked, the "Broken Links" view will open in the right part of the C1 CMS Console:

  • If there are no broken links, the view will read "No broken links found".
  • If there are broken links, the page tree will be displayed and the broken links will be listed under the affected page.

Each broken link will be listed as a link text and the type of a broken link in parentheses. It distinguishes and indicates five types of broken links:

  • No parentheses next to the link text if it is an external broken link, e.g. 'http://dsdsdsdsdsdsdsd.com'
  • '(page does not exist)' if a CMS page doesn't exist
  • '(page is not published)' if a CMS page exists but not published yet
  • '(internal link is broken)' if an internal relative link doesn't exists, e.g. '~/Front-End'
  • '(media file does not exist)' if a media file does not exist in the Media Archive

Add.Title: Contact Form
Add.TeaserDescription: Let visitors leave you messages directly from your website via a contact form.
Add.Content:
Let visitors contact you right from your website

The package allows you to add a contact form to your website so that people visiting your website could send messages to you without leaving the page.

When the visitor submits the message, you will receive an email at the specific address. A copy of the message is also saved on your CMS website in a dedicated data type.

Add.Title: Azure Publisher
Add.TeaserDescription: Synchronize changes between instances of a scaled-out website on Microsoft Azure.
Add.Content:
Synchronize changes between instances of a scaled-out  website on Microsoft Azure

Microsoft Azure with its data centers around the world and its Traffic Manager is perfect for a website that requires load balancing and/or geo-targeting.

C1 CMS with its integration with Microsoft Azure allows you to have a solution where you have a website running, for example, locally on WebMatrix and "push" changes on this "source" website to its multiple online "clone" instances on Microsoft Azure.

You can ensure this synchronization with the Azure Publisher package installed on your source website.

Azure Publisher enables you to publish the changes to your multiple identical website instances on Microsoft Azure provided that these instances in the cloud are "read only" or have Azure-aware code.

Besides, Azure Publisher allows developers to hook their own custom code into the publish flow and modify configuration files, allowing for more advanced publish features.

Add.Title: Add This
Add.TeaserDescription: Let visitors share pages from your website on popular social networks and services.
Add.Content:
Have your web pages shared with the world

The AddThis buttons on your web page allows users to share the current web page with various online services such as FaceBook or Twitter.

The package adds to the page one or more customizable buttons provided by AddThis, the world's largest content sharing platform.

You can use the AddThis function out-of-the-box. However, if you want your personalized AddThis analytics data, you should register with AddThis at https://www.addthis.com/register, get your profile ID and specify it in the ProfileId parameter of the Composite.Community.AddThis function.

Profiles allow publishers to organize and share AddThis analytics data with team members or clients.
